intro: Leandra neurotricha, commonly known as the silky leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
